availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James M. Chandler (Boyle County, KY, resident)

body.p: Boyle County, Kentucky, resident. Virginia native. Married to Effama Chandler. Father of Francis T. Chandler, Matilda Chandler, Sarah Chandler, Virginia Chandler, Emily Chandler, and James Chandler. Resident of Boyle County, Kentucky, in 1860. Oned one enslaved person in Lincoln County, Kentucky, in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Boyle County, p. 944.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Lincoln County, p. 350B.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville Ward 1, p. 46B.
